thread.title: Scalise run for majority leader will be decided Oct. 8
thread.title_full: Scalise run for majority leader will be decided Oct. 8 | NOLA.com

author: Bruce Alpert, NOLA.com | Times-Picayune
title: Scalise run for majority leader will be decided Oct. 8
text:
WASHINGTON â€“ The 247 House Republicans will choose a new leadership team on Thursday October 8.
If Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., wins the race to replace Speaker John Boehner, R-Ohio., who announced his resignation last Friday, there will be a vote for a new majority leader.
Rep. Steve Scalise , R-Jefferson, the current House Majority Whip, is running, as is Rep. Tom Price, R-Ga.
One Republican said he expects that contest for majority leader to be very close. Scalise fits the conservative views of most House Republicans, and won a surprising first ballot win last year to assume the majority whip job. He's generally well liked.
But Price, a physician and a favorite of Tea Party members, is in a position to take advantage of the desire by some GOP caucus members to bring an "outsider" into top House leadership. The majority leader is the No. 2 position in House leadership. Scalise has been the No. 3 leader, as majority whip.
